result.execSummary:
The defendant Brenda K. Nelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice and Report for DNA Sample Slip - Return to Sender, Temporarily Away
Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant.

10:10 AM cases 22CM550, 22CM469 called. Prosecuting Attorney Loralee Clark in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brenda K. Nelson in court with Attorney James H Krave in court. Agreement has been reached. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 

22CM550: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 2:Disorderly Conduct Domestic Abuse
22CM469: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1:Disorderly Conduct Domestic Abuse

Court accepts pleas and finds the Defendant guilty. Court orders court costs, to provide DNA sample and pay applicable surcharges.
Remaining charges are dismissed and read in.

9:39 cases 22CM469 and 22CM550 called. Prosecuting Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brenda K. Nelson in court with Attorney James H Krave.
Hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions: 
No acts or threats of violence against anyone.

(Case called at 10:58 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Brenda Nelson appears in custody via video conference from the Jail with Attorney Alicia Linzmeier. ADA Afton Lewis appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense waives reading of the complaint. Defendant updates address. 
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 06/29/2022 at 2:15 PM. 
Hearing: 07/19/2022 at 9:30 AM.

Conditions:
No acts or threats of violence against anyone.
